newsitem.title: USA: Washington Gov. says backs stadium financing plan.
newsitem.headline: Washington Gov. says backs stadium financing plan.

text.p: Washington Gov. Gary Locke supports the recommendations of a task force to finance a new stadium for the Seattle Seahawks National Football League team with $281 million of bonds and other funds, his office said Friday.
A spokeswoman for Locke said he was "supportive" of the recommendations of the Blue Ribbon Stadium Financing Task Force, but said the financing plan has yet to be finalized.
The task force recommended a package that would combine private and public funds to finance construction of a $402 million facility and provide over $20 million annually for related projects.
The package includes a $326 million stadium, a $35 million exhibition facility, a $26 million parking structure, and $15 million in funding for site preparations.
The package also calls for an $18 million per year educational technology program and for a $4 million per year capital improvement program.
"The task force has sought a financing mechanism that relies on contributions from all partners to the facility," the task force said in its report.
From private sources, including the sale of seat licenses, the task force said $100 million would be raised.
